conclusion: The speed of the elevator at t=60s can be determined by calculating the area under the acceleration-time graph from t=0 to t=60s.
The area under the graph represents the change in velocity.
From t=0 to t=5s, the acceleration is constant at 2 m/s².
The area under this part of the graph is a rectangle with a base of 5s and a height of 2 m/s². The area is 5s * 2 m/s² = 10 m/s.
From t=5s to t=55s, the acceleration is constant at 0 m/s².
The area under this part of the graph is a rectangle with a base of 50s and a height of 0 m/s². The area is 50s * 0 m/s² = 0 m/s.
From t=55s to t=60s, the acceleration is constant at -2 m/s².
The area under this part of the graph is a rectangle with a base of 5s and a height of -2 m/s². The area is 5s * -2 m/s² = -10 m/s.
The total area under the graph from t=0 to t=60s is 10 m/s + 0 m/s + -10 m/s = 0 m/s.
Therefore, the speed of the elevator at t=60s is 0 m/s.
